header_summary:
Cory Fields details Hennadii Stepanov's efforts in transitioning Bitcoin Core's build system from Autotools to CMake, signifying a crucial development phase aimed at modernizing the project and enhancing its overall efficiency for developers. The new build system, poised for integration, underscores the importance of community feedback to address challenges on less common platforms ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/6cfd5a56-84b4-4cbc-a211-dd34b8942f77n@googlegroups.com/T/#u#m4526371f167fea9fe6a681f529d7ac400cb35906)).

Keagan McClelland proposes an optional rebroadcasting module for Bitcoin Core to mitigate replacement cycling attacks, balancing the innovation against potential risks such as enabling Denial of Service (DOS) attacks and complicating mempool transaction management ([source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALeFGL1dLhdvdePzt5xdZxskcU6WJDJL_PSmO2u2Z1nKZCKMag@mail.gmail.com/T/#mce4c84ffa5b02ea3b8275bdef2d4cabab77de1ae)).

Garlo Nicon suggests starting updates on test networks like testnet3 due to their similarity to the mainnet, but highlights concerns over "transaction expiration" and the practicality of solutions targeting network integrity. Meanwhile, a paper presented at the Financial Cryptography and Data Security 2024 conference by Amin Bashiri and Majid Khabbazian introduces strategies to mitigate denial-of-service (DoS) threats in Onion Messaging, advocating for limitations on message hops and a proof-of-work (PoW) mechanism to enhance the Lightning Network's security ([source](https://fc24.ifca.ai/preproceedings/104.pdf)).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core's migration to the CMake buildsystem
recent_posts.summary:
- Hennadii Stepanov has led the shift of Bitcoin Core's build system to CMake.
- The CMake system enhances Bitcoin Core and its dependencies, benefiting the open-source community.
- This transition focuses on reducing automation and requires developers to adjust their workflows.

recent_posts.title: Keyless Anchors Are Vulnerable To Replacement Cycling Attacks
recent_posts.summary:
- A proposal introduces a rebroadcasting module to Bitcoin Core to tackle replacement cycling attacks.
- Concerns exist about the module potentially enabling Denial of Service attacks and straining node resources.
- The module's implementation requires complex management of transaction priorities within the mempool.

recent_posts.title: Bolt 12 Trusted Contacts
recent_posts.summary:
- David Harding expresses concerns over phishing attacks in payment systems via contact manipulation.
- He highlights a scenario where attackers could trick users into making unauthorized payments.
- Harding suggests educating users on trusting payment amounts over contact names for security.

recent_posts.title: Onion Messaging DoS Threat Mitigations
recent_posts.summary:
- The FC'24 conference featured Bashiri and Khabbazian's paper on mitigating OM DoS threats.
- They propose a "Hard Leash" for hop limits and a "Soft Leash" requiring PoW for additional hops.
- Their research suggests rate limiting and capacity-aware routing to improve Lightning Network security.

active_posts.title: Public disclosure of 2 vulnerabilities affecting Bitcoin Core < v22.0
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core has found bugs in versions before v22.0 and is updating its security policy.
- New vulnerabilities will be disclosed starting with version v23.0 in August, then v24.0 in September.
- A systematic disclosure process demonstrates Bitcoin Core's dedication to transparency and security.

active_posts.title: Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The analysis suggests improvements to Bitcoin to enhance network security and performance.
- It proposes fixing vulnerabilities like the timewarp exploit and Merkle root computation issues.

active_posts.title: Stats on compact block reconstructions
active_posts.summary:
- Analysis of `debug=cmpctblock` shows insights into Bitcoin block reconstruction efficiency.
- Node configuration changes, like `mempoolfullrbf=1`, improved block reconstruction processes.
- Investigation reveals disparities in reconstruction times, hinting at optimization paths.

today_in_history_posts.title: Bitcoin vaults with anti-theft recovery/clawback mechanisms
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The article introduces pre-signed bitcoin vaults for cold storage without requiring soft-forks.
- It highlights a delay mechanism for security, enabling coin recovery options and observing potential theft.
- Techniques for enforcing covenants and improving financial privacy in Bitcoin through pre-signed transactions are discussed.

today_in_history_posts.title: Proposal: Automated Inbound Liquidity With Invoices
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal automates instant liquidity for Lightning Network payments via invoices.
- It includes embedding the invoice creator's node uri and the routing amount.
- Details like channel size and routing node premiums require further discussion.

today_in_history_posts.summary:
